alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 5:27PM PDT until July 10 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL CHELAN COUNTY... At 527 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms have produced locally heavy rain in North central Chelan county including the 25 Mile Burn Scar south of Lake Chelan. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams as well as steep terrain in and near the 25 Mile Burn Scar. Some locations included in this warning include... Grouse Mountain Campground, Fox Creek Campground, Ramona Park Campground, Silver Falls Campground and 25 Mile Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry creek beds is likely. Motorists should be preapred to encounter debris on roads from rockslides or mudslides. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
